result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian A Duda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle T&R in defendants name, as is defendant himself.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: 31 days STAYED, 14 days to SERVE.  To begin within 45 days at discretion of the agent.  Jail time with huber for work/treatment or EMP if defendant qualifies

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian A Duda

defendant.name: Duda, Brian A
defendant.address: S3197 County Rd V, Spencer, WI 54479

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request for Ignition Interlock Exemptions - stj
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:37 am 
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher; Def appears in person, pro se.  
Waiver of Right to Atty filed. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd (with passenger < 16 yrs old))>>DELETE minor passenger enhancer pursuant to 346.63(1)(a). 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 18 months probation - CONDITIONS: SSTOP; $1694 inclusive; 45 days MCJ with huber for work/treatment or EMP if def qualifies - 31 days STAYED and 14 days to be served - to begin within 45 days at discretion of the agent; Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 1 year, as is the defendant himself; 24 month dl revocation with administrative credit; AODA. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 1 day jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 11:48 am

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Status conference on June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on July 27, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 9:26 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher. Defendant appears in person without counsel. Attorney Brubacher notes parties have reached an agreement and defendant needs to be approved for SSTOP. Court questions defendant re: right to counsel and advises of rights. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. 
COURT waives time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
STC & Plea Hearing to be set with JA following court. 
Bond is continued. 
Adj: 9:28 a.m.

Shall not consume alcohol. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license. Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 on or before 5/25/15.
